info.title: CISCO-FTP-CLIENT-MIB MIB API
info.description:
The MIB module for invoking Internet File Transfer Protocol
    (FTP) operations for network management purposes.

⚠️ **IMPORTANT - MIB DATA ACCESS**:
This YANG model exists for SMIv2-to-YANG translation purposes, but MIB data on IOS-XE devices is primarily accessed via **SNMP protocol**, not RESTCONF.

**RESTCONF Limitation**: Many MIB paths may return 404 errors via RESTCONF `/data` endpoints because the device exposes MIB data through SNMP, not the YANG datastore.

**Recommended Access Methods**:
- Use SNMP (v2c/v3) to query MIB data directly
- Use NETCONF `<get>` operations for devices supporting YANG-modeled MIB access
- Check device capabilities: some newer IOS-XE versions may support limited RESTCONF access to specific MIBs

**YANG Model Purpose**: These YANG models define the structure of SNMP MIBs in YANG format for tooling compatibility, but do not guarantee RESTCONF data availability.

get.description: Retrieve cfcRequest operational data from MIB
Retrieve cfcRequestTable operational data from MIB
Retrieve list of cfcRequestEntry entries from MIB
Retrieve specific cfcRequestEntry entry by key from MIB
Retrieve list of cfcRequestEntry entries from MIB
Retrieve specific cfcRequestEntry entry by key from MIB

cfcRequestMaximum.description:
The maximum number of requests this system can hold in
          cfcRequestTable.  A value of 0 indicates no configured limit.
          
          This object may be read-only on some systems.
          
          When an attempt is made to create a new entry but the table
          is full, the oldest completed entry is bumped out and
          cfcRequestsBumped is incremented.
          
          Changing this number does not disturb existing requests that
          are not completed and bumps completed requests as necessary.

cfcRequests.description: The current number of requests in cfcRequestTable.

cfcRequestsHigh.description:
The highest number of requests in cfcRequestTable since this
          system was last initialized.

cfcRequestsBumped.description:
The number of requests in cfcRequestTable that were bumped
          out to make room for a new request.

cfcRequestIndex.description:
An arbitrary integer to uniquely identify this entry.  To
            create an entry a management application should pick a
            random number.

cfcRequestOperation.description: The FTP operation to be performed.

cfcRequestLocalFile.description: The local file on which the operation is to be performed.

cfcRequestRemoteFile.description: The remote file on which the operation is to be performed.

cfcRequestServer.description: The domain name or IP address of the FTP server to use.

cfcRequestUser.description: The user name to use at the FTP server.

cfcRequestPassword.description:
The password to use at the FTP server.
            
            When read this object always returns a zero-length string.

cfcRequestResult.description: The result of the FTP operation.

cfcRequestCompletionTime.description:
The value of sysUpTime when the operation completed.  For
            an incomplete operation this value is zero.

cfcRequestStop.description:
The action control to stop a running request.  Setting this to
            'stop' will begin the process of stopping the request.  Setting
            it to 'ready' or setting it to 'stop' more than once have no
            effect.  When read this object always returns ready.

cfcRequestOperationState.description:
The operational state of the file transfer.  To short-terminate
            the transfer set cfcRequestStop to 'stop'.

cfcRequestEntryStatus.description:
The control that allows modification, creation, and deletion
            of entries.  For detailed rules see the DESCRIPTION for
            cfcRequestEntry.

cfcRequestTable.description: A table of FTP client requests.

            create an entry a management application should pick a

cfcRequestRemoteFile.description: The remote file on which the operation is to be performed.

cfcRequestServer.description: The domain name or IP address of the FTP server to use.

cfcRequestUser.description: The user name to use at the FTP server.

cfcRequestPassword.description:
The password to use at the FTP server.
